form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Heller (for himself, Mr. Bennet, and Mr. Blunt) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to strengthen intensive cardiac rehabilitation programs under the Medicare program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Strengthening Medicare Intensive Cardiac Rehabilitation Programs Act of 2015.

section.header: Revised requirements for Medicare intensive care rehabilitation programs
section.text: Section 1861(eee)(4) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395x(eee)(4)) is amended—

clause.text: by striking physician-supervised program (as described in paragraph (2)) and inserting program (supervised as described in paragraph (2)); and
by striking , in peer-reviewed published research, that it accomplished and inserting in peer-reviewed published research of its own program, that by lifestyle changes alone it accomplished;
in subclause (I), by striking positively affected and inserting reversed;
in subclause (II), by striking or and inserting and; and

subparagraph.text: in clause (ii), in the matter preceding subclause (I), by inserting both a statistically significant increase in the measure of blood flow to the heart when compared to a control group and before a statistically significant; and
by adding at the end the following new sentence:

quoted-block.quoted-block-continuation-text: Programs that the Secretary approved under this paragraph before August 1, 2015, as intensive cardiac rehabilitation programs according to the requirements under this subparagraph before the date of the enactment of the Strengthening Medicare Intensive Cardiac Rehabilitation Programs Act of 2015 shall be deemed to meet the requirements under this subparagraph applied pursuant to the amendments made by such Act.

subparagraph.text: in clause (v), by striking at the end or;
in clause (vi), by striking at the end the period; and
by adding at the end the following new clauses:

clause.text: stable, chronic heart failure (defined as patients with left ventricular ejection fraction of 35 percent or less and New York Heart Association (NYHA) class II to IV symptoms despite being on optimal heart failure therapy for at least 6 weeks); or
any additional condition for which the Secretary has determined that a cardiac rehabilitation program shall be covered.
